tutorial.title: Shrinking Flex Items
tutorial.descriptionContent: Learn how to shrink flex items with Flexbox.

lessons.title: Intro
lessons.interactiveContent:
Let's learn how to make flex items shrink inside their container when there isn't enough room.

Try out the different settings to see how shrinking works.

lessons.title: Container width
lessons.interactiveContent:
Designs that shrink are great for smaller devices, like phones. We'll mimic a smaller screen with a smaller container width.

Make sure to pick width followed by : and then 250px, ;.

lessons.title: Flex basis
lessons.interactiveContent:
Flex items shrink when they can't expand to their flex-basis value. Let's set flex-basis to 200px for elements of class item.

Make sure to pick flex-basis followed by : and then 200px, ;.

lessons.title: Flex shrink default
lessons.interactiveContent:
To shrink flex items, we use the flex-shrink property. The default value is 1.

Make sure to pick flex-shrink:, followed by 1.

lessons.title: Zero
lessons.interactiveContent:
If we set the flex-shrink value to 0, then the item doesn't shrink at all. Here, it stays at 200px, while the other item still shrinks.

Make sure to pick 0.

lessons.title: Overflow
lessons.interactiveContent:
If we set both items to flex-shrink: 0, they overflow outside of their containers.

Make sure to pick 0, followed by 0.

lessons.title: Bigger
lessons.interactiveContent:
To make a flex item shrink more than others, we give it a bigger flex-shrink number. Make the first item shrink more than the second.

Make sure to pick 2, followed by 1.

lessons.title: Different numbers
lessons.interactiveContent:
We can set different ratios to provide different sizes for each flex item. To make each item smaller than the previous one, add 1, 2, and 3.

Make sure to pick 1, followed by 2, and finally 3.

lessons.title: Try out
lessons.interactiveContent: Try out different flex-direction and flex-shrink values to get a better sense of how it works.

lessons.title: Question: Flex basis
lessons.interactiveContent:
When do we say that a flex item shrinks?

When its size is less than its initial flex-basis sizeOnly when it's the same size as its content

When its size is less than its initial flex-basis size.

lessons.title: Question: Flex shrink default
lessons.interactiveContent:
What is the default flex-shrink value?

10

Make sure to pick 1.

lessons.title: Question: Zero
lessons.interactiveContent:
What happens when we set flex-shrink to 0?

The flex item doesn't shrink at allThe flex item shrinks to the size of its content

The flex item doesn't shrink at all.

lessons.title: Question: Overflow
lessons.interactiveContent:
What does this code display?

Two flex items that won't shrinkTwo flex items that will shrink

Two flex items that won't shrink.

lessons.title: Question: Bigger
lessons.interactiveContent:
How do we make a flex item shrink more than another?

By giving it a bigger flex-shrink valueBy giving it a smaller flex-shrink value

By giving it a bigger flex-shrink value.

lessons.title: Question: Different numbers
lessons.interactiveContent:
Tap the slider to see how the items react. Which flex item has the biggest flex-shrink value?

Flex item 3Flex item 1

Flex item 3.

lessons.title: Example: Flex basis
lessons.interactiveContent:
To make flex items have an initial value to shrink from, set flex-basis to 150px.

Make sure to pick 150px.

lessons.title: Example: Flex basis 2
lessons.interactiveContent:
To make sure we see the flex-shrink changes, set the container width to 250px.

Make sure to pick 250px.

lessons.title: Example: Default
lessons.interactiveContent:
Add the shrink property and default value.

Make sure to pick flex-shrink:, followed by 1;.

lessons.title: Example: Zero
lessons.interactiveContent:
Code 0 to make the second flex item not shrink.

Make sure to type 0.

lessons.title: Example: Overflow
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make both flex items overflow the container and not shrink by coding 0 as the flex-shrink value.

Make sure to pick 0, followed by 0.

lessons.title: Example: Bigger
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make the second flex item shrink more than the first.

Make sure to pick 1, followed by 3.

lessons.title: Example: Different numbers
lessons.interactiveContent:
Make the first flex item shrink the most and the second shrink the least.

Make sure to pick 5, followed by 1.
